subtitleNullable: Dance genre recognition from audio recordings
descriptionNullable:
### Context

 Dance genre classification is a topic within the research field music information retrieval (MIR) and it aims to recognize a dance classes from a given audio recording.

The problem of predicting dance class from audio recordings is interesting from both theoretical and practical perspectives. The core of the dance recognition problem is to encode low-level information from a raw audio signal and to produce a semantic high-level information. The process of extracting such
high-level information from music is similar to music perception by humans, and can be used for applications as music discovery and recommendation. We benefit from employing the dance music, because a large amount of audio data is publicly available. Various audio recordings of dance music can be extracted either from YouTube or from video recordings of dance competitions, that experience increasing popularity. The categorization of such music data is usually within video or track titles, thus the data can be easily labeled. Moreover, dance recognition is beneficial for beginners or amateur dancers that have difficulties to recognize the dance genre from the music. 
#  

#   
[![IMAGE ALT TEXT](http://img.youtube.com/vi/FCLDLt3Ly5Q/0.jpg)](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FCLDLt3Ly5Q&feature=youtu.be "Dance Recognition Supplementary Video")
*Dance Recognition Supplementary Video*

### Content

whole data splited to  testing and validation dataset. It is distributed as an archive with two text files corresponding to test and validation dataset. Each text file contains links to YouTube videos with ballroom music along with label for each link. Both testing and validation datasets consist of 10 classes of 6 recordings each which implies 120 recordings in both testing and validation datasets.

Classes: 
Cha Cha Cha, Jive, Paso Doble, Rumba, Samba, Quickstep, Slow Foxtrot, Slow Waltz, Tango and Viennese Waltz.

### Acknowledgements

Tomas Pavlin, Jan Cech, Jiri Matas. Ballroom Dance Recognition from Audio Recordings. In Proc. 25th ICPR, 2020.
http://ironbrain.net/dance/thesis.pdf
[More Info](http://ironbrain.net/dance/)


### Inspiration

- Dance genre classification from Audio Recordings.
